wikipedia_page.main: Squadron Leader Thomas Carlyon Luke  (21 July 1891 – 1 July 1935) was a British World War I flying ace credited with six aerial victories.

link_mentions.page: List of World War I aces credited with 6 victories

response: Flying a Sopwith Camel, between 11 April and 11 August 1918 he accounted for seven enemy aircraft destroyed or driven down out of control; four solo and three shared with other pilots, including Roy Brown, Robert Foster and Thomas Luke.

link_mentions.page: List of World War I flying aces from the British Empire
